neighbors.name: Woodlot Farms LLC
neighbors.claims: Woodlot Farms LLC is a Kentucky limited liability company that owns parcel 52-2 in Caldwell County, with no other known business operations beyond holding this farmland [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=21033&progcode=totalfarm&regionname=CaldwellCounty,Kentucky). The LLC does not appear among any recipients of USDA farm subsidies or H-2A farm labor petitions, indicating minimal active farming activity under its name [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=21033&progcode=totalfarm&regionname=CaldwellCounty,Kentucky). No information on its managers or beneficial owners is publicly available in state filings, suggesting it is a private land investment vehicle (beneficial owner unknown) [Kentucky Secretary of State](https://sos.ky.gov). There is no record of political contributions, public statements, or litigation involving Woodlot Farms LLC, implying a low public profile and no evident stance on local development issues [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=21033&progcode=totalfarm&regionname=CaldwellCounty,Kentucky).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small landholding with no visible business or political activity; ownership and resources not publicly evident

approach_recommendations.engage: Determine the owner behind the LLC via property records and approach them discreetly with assurances that the project will not diminish land value; if they are investors, consider offering a purchase or partnership opportunity to align interests

neighbors.name: Gilkey Farms Inc
neighbors.claims: Gilkey Farms Inc is an established Kentucky farm corporation (incorporated in 1959) tied to the Gilkey family of Princeton, KY, a prominent multigenerational farming family [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mm2p73x/gilkey-farm-inc). Members of the Gilkey family collectively rank among the top farm subsidy recipients in Caldwell County – for example, Trevor Gilkey has received over $2 million in commodity subsidies since 1995, with other family members (Christie and Donnie Gilkey) receiving nearly $1 million each [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?zip=42445). This indicates extensive row-crop farming operations and significant acreage under cultivation in the county. The family maintains a large farming operation (noted in pea and bean production) and has a vested interest in local agricultural land use [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mm2p73x/gilkey-farm-inc). A principal of the family, Ronald Gilkey, even received a $20,600 Paycheck Protection Program loan in 2020 to cover farm payroll, underscoring the farm’s economic footprint and the family’s engagement with federal programs [ProPublica](https://projects.propublica.org/coronavirus/bailouts/loans/ronald-gilkey-9422258802). The Gilkeys are well-known locally and likely have influence in community and agricultural circles, though they have not publicly declared a position on new developments in the area.
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns extensive acreage; longstanding family presence; top subsidy recipients; strong local agricultural ties and political visibility

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Gilkey family directly (e.g., through a senior family member like Trevor or Donnie Gilkey) to discuss the project’s impact on farmland and community; emphasize how the development can coexist with local agriculture and possibly offer benefits (tax revenue or infrastructure) that do not harm farming interests

neighbors.name: Saddle Ridge Farm LLC
neighbors.claims: Saddle Ridge Farm LLC is a limited liability company owning parcel 52-3 in Caldwell County; it appears to function as a family farm or landholding entity, though public information on its principals is scarce. The LLC’s name suggests an agricultural or possibly equine operation, but it is not listed among major farm subsidy recipients or agricultural employers in the area, indicating a small-scale or private operation [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=21033&progcode=totalfarm&regionname=CaldwellCounty,Kentucky). No corporate website or media references exist for Saddle Ridge Farm LLC, and no officers or members are readily identifiable via state records (beneficial ownership remains undisclosed) [Kentucky Secretary of State](https://sos.ky.gov). The organization has not been involved in any notable public disputes or development debates based on available records, implying it has not taken a public stance on local development proposals. Its focus is likely on managing its farm property quietly, without external business ventures or political engagement.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private farm with limited public presence or economic footprint; no known connections to local governance or large networks

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person to the farm’s owner (once identified, likely a family member) to build trust; address any concerns about noise, visuals, or effects on livestock and farmland, and offer accommodations such as setbacks or landscape buffering to maintain the area’s rural character

overview_summary: The neighboring parcels are held by two private farm LLCs and one long-standing family farm corporation. Their influence varies widely – the Gilkey family’s farm is a multigenerational operation with significant acreage and local clout, while Woodlot Farms LLC and Saddle Ridge Farm LLC are lower-profile landholding entities. None have publicly stated positions on new development, though the Gilkeys’ prominence suggests they could be key opinion leaders. Potential concerns range from farmland preservation to property value impacts, and engaging these owners will require tailored outreach.
